intro: Penicillaria cordofana, commonly known as the heartleaf penicillaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
